Yes, the normalizer has to know about the padding. Also, changing num_true to an input tensor will change the order in the parameters, so it's an interface change.

Probably the best is to create a new copy of the operator in contrib. I think that would be a fine contribution!

(To use a tensor parameter, simply change the .attr to .input and then change the kernel to get the input from the context each time Compute is requested.)

body:
Yes, the normalizer has to know about the padding. Also, changing `num_true` to an input tensor will change the order in the parameters, so it's an interface change.

Probably the best is to create a new copy of the operator in `contrib`. I think that would be a fine contribution!

(To use a tensor parameter, simply change the `.attr` to `.input` and then change the kernel to get the input from the context each time `Compute` is requested.)
